alert.note: Alert for Oconee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 11:59PM EDT until July 19 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Rabun County in northeastern Georgia... Eastern Macon County in western North Carolina... Southwestern Transylvania County in western North Carolina... Jackson County in western North Carolina... Southeastern Swain County in western North Carolina... Northeastern Oconee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 1245 AM EDT. * At 1159 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bryson City to 6 miles east of Franklin to 8 miles east of Clayton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Sylva, Bryson City, Cherokee, Cullowhee, Highlands, Balsam, Webster, Dillsboro, Cashiers and Lake Toxaway. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
